There are also ammonia sensors within the Machine Room 1.  At 25 ppm, the audible and visual alarms are activated inside the Machine Room and a signal is sent to an auto dialer to alert ADT as well as facility's operators.  ADT is instructed to call the fire dpartment.  At 125 ppm, the following actions take place: (1) Shut down of solenoid valves in order to isolate the ammonia and (2) the emergency ventilation fan is turned on.  A final shutdown occurs at 10,000 ppm which de-energizes all of the equipment in the Machine Room including the compressors.  The facility is equipped with an automatic shut off button located outside of the Machine room.  If a release were to occur, operators can activate this prevention measure.

The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures, which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility.  This Plan is reviewed and updated at least once per year.  This Plan was reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM, RMP, and CalARP regulations as well as to incorporate facility changes.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

The 2016 PHA Revalidation study and the 2016 Seismic Assessment Update study generated mitigation measures (recommendations) to improve safety at the CSM Bakery Solutions facility located in Colton, California.  The mitigation measures include additional training, update standard operating procedures, updating the piping diagrams, and key maintenance related tests/inspection.  

The CSM Bakery Products safety committee is planning to complete several items, including the recommendations, over the next year, as a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees.  These changes include the following items:

1. Continue to train all employees in the facility Safety Plan/Programs.

2. Continue to have employee involvement in Safety Plan Development.

3. Continue employee involvement through safety team participation.

4. Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.

Low pressure (cold) liquid ammonia provides refrigeration by removing ambient heat.  Removal of ambient heat causes the liquid ammonia (contained within the system) to vaporize.  Heat is later removed from the ammonia as it is condensed back into a liquid.  Typical operating conditions for System 1 range from 5 Hg on the low pressure side of the system to 160 psig on the high side.  Typical operating conditions for System 2 range from 5 Hg on the low pressure side of the system to 160 psig on the high side.

Ammonia is used as the refrigerant in two separate and independent refrigeration processes.  The ammonia inventory in the original system is 19,100 pounds, while the second system (July 2001) contains an ammonia inventory of 22,500 pounds. 

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

A prevention program is in place to minimize the risk of hazardous chemical releases in accordance with the California Occupational Safety and Health Administration (CalOSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (Section 5189 of Title 8, CCR), the EPA Risk Management Program (RMP), and the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program.  This prevention program covers those processes that handle anhydrous ammonia above the threshold quantity.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

The customers of CSM Bakery Solutions are both large and small. They look to us for excellent value, dependable delivery, consistent formulas and hands-on service. Since our inception in 1971, our simple goal has been to be the most reliable and responsive company in our industry.  The CSM Bakery Solutions management is not only committed to offering superior service, but also to maintaining a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surround communities.  CSM Bakery Solutions' safety and environmental policies are administered by the Maintenance Manager, who oversees the entire safety and environmental programs, including the PSM/RMP/CalARP Program for the anhydrous ammonia systems.

CSM Bakery Solutions employees conduct ongoing inspections, testing, and replacement of the critical items in the ammonia refrigeration systems and the aqueous ammonia system.  The ammonia refrigeration systems are inspected daily by the Maintenance personnel.  A record of the maintenance or work performed on the systems is maintained onsite.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE

The CSM Bakery Solutions facility is located at 2111 West Valley Blvd. in Colton, California.  The facility is located approximately 0.1 mile north of the Interstate 10 and approximately 3.1 miles west of Highway 215.  The area immediately surrounding the facility is primarily urban with light commercial and residential areas.  

The ammonia refrigeration processes are used for the production and storage of a variety of food products in their processing area and cold storage warehouse. FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

EPA's RMP regulation defines accident as the following: 

The release must be from a covered process and involve a regulated substance held above its threshold quantity in the process. The release must have caused at least one of the following: 

¿	On-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage (§68.42(a)); or
¿	Known offsite deaths, injuries, property damage, environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place (§68.42(a)). 

Based on an investigation into the facility's accident history conducted at the time of the PHA study (July 12, 2016), there have been no incidents that meet the EPA definition of an accident in the last five years (July 2011 - July 2016). 

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

CSM Bakery Solutions has an emergency response plan in effect at the facility.  In the case of an ammonia-related emergency, facility management will determine if an evacuation is necessary.  It is the policy of CSM Bakery Solutions to evacuate the employees and call 911 in order to reach the San Bernardino County Fire Department HazMat team who will respond to the emergency (potentially with the assistance of trained contractor or facility personnel). 

Employees and contractors of CSM Bakery Solutions are obligated to report any significant releases or potential releases of hazardous materials including ammonia.
